channel.title: Delta Client / Login sprites, I want to change it
channel.description:
[img]http://img168.imageshack.us/img168/7610/deltahj2.jpg[/img]
I want to change this image.. it is not in the sprites or anywhere else that I can tell.. it has to be somewhere... I don't know the name of the image..
I was able to figure it out with the butterscape client, it was called, "titlebox" and "titlebutton"
there is nothing like that in deltascape client.. I can change it, I was hoping someone might be able to tell what it is I am looking for..
I am not looking for graphics help, I am trying to find it..
thx!

item.title: Delta Client / Login sprites, I want to change it
item.dc:creator: @I1_Sn1p3r_I1 I1 Sn1p3r I1
item.description:
@I1_Sn1p3r_I1 wrote:

Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:1039: illegal start of type else if (s.startsWith("loginbox")){ ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:1039: ';' expected else if (s.startsWith("loginbox")){ ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:1039: illegal start of type else if (s.startsWith("loginbox")){ ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:1039: ';' expected else if (s.startsWith("loginbox")){ ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:1039: invalid method declaration; return type requir ed else if (s.startsWith("loginbox")){ ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:1039: illegal start of type else if (s.startsWith("loginbox")){ ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:1039: ';' expected else if (s.startsWith("loginbox")){ ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:1049: illegal start of type else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("loginbutton")); ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:1049: ';' expected else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("loginbutton")); ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:1049: illegal start of type else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("loginbutton")); ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:1049: ';' expected else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("loginbutton")); ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:1049: invalid method declaration; return type requir ed else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("loginbutton")); ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:1049: illegal start of type else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("loginbutton")); ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:1049: ';' expected else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("loginbutton")); ^ 14 errors Press any key to continue . . .

how to fix?

item.source: Delta Client / Login sprites, I want to change it

item.title: Delta Client / Login sprites, I want to change it
item.dc:creator: @Goth_Wolf Goth Wolf
item.description:
@Goth_Wolf wrote:

Delta doesn’t use imagegrabber for the login box -.- your going to have to follow a tutorial to change them

I take no credits for this tutorial it was made by Super_Squirrel on R~S

[QUOTE=Super_Squirrel]I was trying to find this out myself, I found it stupid that nobody had bothered making a tut, In the end I did it by messing around. Heres my method.

Note: This will only work with client which already have sprites (Added before.)

Difficulty: 1/10
Assumed knowlege: C&P, CTRL + F, compiling and saving

Firstly you must go into your client.java and search for:

public final void method51(int i)

Under there you should find some code similar to this:
public final void method51(int i) { aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_966 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(aClass44_1053, "titlebox", 0); if(i <= 0) aBoolean1231 = !aBoolean1231; aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_967 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(aClass44_1053, "titlebutton", 0); aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1152 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2[12]; int j = 0; try { j = Integer.parseInt(getParameter("fl_icon")); }
Replace that code with this code:

    public final void method51(int i)
    {
        aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_966 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(aClass44_1053, "titlebox", 0);
        aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_1291 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(aClass44_1053, "titlebox", 0);
        if(i <= 0)
                aBoolean1231 = !aBoolean1231;
        aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_967 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(aClass44_1053, "titlebutton", 0);
        aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_1292 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(aClass44_1053, "titlebutton", 0);
        aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1152 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2[12];
        int j = 0;
        try
        {
            j = Integer.parseInt(getParameter("fl_icon"));
        }

Then search for:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_966.method361

Quote that out (//) and add this underneth:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_1291.method348(0, 16083, 0);

Then search for:

private Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1

Then add these:

private Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_1291;
private Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_1292;

Now scroll up to the top of your document and search for (What one of your login button says):

Log In

There you will see this code or similar:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method382(0xffffff, l, anInt939, "@whi@About", k1 + 5, true);

Above that code you will see:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_967.method361

Change that code to this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_1292.method348

Now save and leave your client open (incase of error, CTRL + Z)

Open up Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java

Then add these:

else if (s.startsWith("titlebox")){
		try{
			Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./sprites/loginbox.png");
			anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
			PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
			pixelgrabber.grabPixels();
		}catch (Exception exception){
			System.out.println("could not load: "+s+" "+i+".jpg");
		}
	}
		 else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("titlebutton"))
{
try
{
				Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./Sprites/loginbutton.png");
				anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
				PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
				pixelgrabber.grabPixels();
			}
			catch (Exception exception)
			{
				System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
			}
		}

The sprites must be put in /Sprites/ folder and the button must be called loginbutton and saved in the png format and the box must be called loginbox also in the png format. (.png)[/quote]

you can probly go in ur sprites and make a new pic there called “titlebox” and make another1 called “titlebutton” and save them as png and then go to 1 of your class files that represents them and then replace with you main path to the spites for it.
